intro: Ayenia noblickii, commonly known as the noble ayenia, is a rare flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and latex-producing structures. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats, showcasing adaptations to arid environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and hairy, helping to reduce water loss. The flowers, which bloom in late spring, are yellow with a distinctive central disc, contributing to its ornamental value.
